moduleMethods.methodDescription: Takes a string of HTML markup and returns the parsed HTML code.

methodArguments.argumentDescription: a string of markup to be parsed

moduleMethods.methodDescription: Parses the content of an HTML element and places the parsed result as the content of another element.

methodArguments.argumentDescription: The source element that holds the content to be parsed. This will be fetched using either .innerHTML or .value attributes.
The target element that will hold the parsed result as its content. if ommited, the target element is assumed to be the sourceElement and a content replacement is performed instead.

moduleDescription: Codebox performs HTML parsing in order to display HTML markup code in a webpage. The parser identifies and wraps every relevant HTML character inside new HTML elements, so that each character of the original code can be displayed in a browser.
